Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> Question: Is Verus' explorer as comprehensive/functional as other explorers in the crypto space? i.e: can one view what amounts individual addresses/wallets hold on the blockchain? And also, is it possible to determine that a group of addresses belong to the same wallet? e.g: can it be determined, without having access to one's Agama wallet, that all 100 addresses that come with that wallet belong to one wallet/account, simply by viewing the explorer?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @jintaa yes and no. it is possible to track connections between transparent addresses, but when they go into the private pool of funds, any direct connection to their source or destination is broken. Still, with deeper analysis, it is also possible to track some funds into the pool and assign probability of those transfers being related to others of similar amounts out shortly after being somehow related. Having both transparent and private addresses makes privacy possible, but unless you have a forced, fully private chain, like Pirate, which then has some challenges with programmability, you may be able to analyze to some degree, unless people are trying to preserve privacy intentionally.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> Ok, @miketout , how about being able to determine if the 100 addresses assigned to an agama wallet all belong to the same wallet, just by looking at the explorer? Are the addresses randomly assigned to each wallet, or are they somehow linked, even on the blockchain/explorer?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> wallets generate addresses that cant be linked

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> however usage can end up linking them, especially via change

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> or using multiple addresses as vin inputs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> what I see on BTC is that some entity is sending small tainted dust amounts 0,000005 to the largest BTC addresses. then when these wallets do a spend, the tainted dust is spent and creates a linkage to the other input addresses and output addresses

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> this allows construction (over time) a pretty accurate statistical mapping of email address to BTC address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> and ip address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> @jl777c buddy can i ask your opinion on something.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> combine this with the KYC info that exchanges (and hackers) have and transparent addresses, lives up to its name

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> of course, not everyone and certainly not the explorers will have access to the ip router level correlations or exchange KYC info

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> @GlorymanRTS What you proposed is gambling, unless you have enough to control the market, thus minimizing the risk.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> So, it's gambling but it could pay off?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> With my luck whenever I'd sell it would be right before a bull run.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> But if there is a bull run, the price will come back down in future and u can just buy again when the price is low right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> If it were that simple. It's a gamble either way.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Someone has to be willing to buy at the price you're selling, and someone has to be willing to sell at the price you're buying. Pure and simple.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> @zpajk thanks for it advice buddy, it's appreciated.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> ``1000 VRSC sell at 0,00003100 BTC = 0,031 BTC
0,031 BTC buy back at 0,00002500 BTC = 1240 VRSC``
240 VRSC gain, if it goes through. Only you can determine if it's worth the risk. Multiply that with whatever the amount you were thinking. But greater amount would equal less chance of hitting full bids/asks because of the low volume on the exchanges.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Vycid> This is called market making. You can do it with any commodity. Most commodities are more heavily traded than Verus so the spread is not so wide and they are less profitable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Vycid> But there are companies which exist to do exactly what is described here and they certainly are profitable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Vycid> The wrinkle is that you need to consistently be the top of book at the bid and the ask, which means you need to fight with others (read: bots) trying to do the exact same thing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Vycid> The other risk is that the underlying commodity moves out of the channel you have identified. It's hard to estimate the size of that risk for Verus

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <gamer278> What is the difference in connections? since the start of mining verus back over the summer I always had 4 connections. After upgrading to 0.5.5 i know have 5 connections. Any benefit to more connections?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Vycid> yes, more connections means that new blocks will propagate to you faster

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Vycid> reduces the time you spend mining stale blocks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> it's a great benefit to all 'full node' operators like pool operators, explorers and such (also for the electrum servers respectively the vrsc nodes behind). before it was rather hard to build up a number of connections. now, it's much easier

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> and while the increase by 1 on your local end won't do much difference for you guys but in some edge cases where 4 of the 5 are not responding (), my pool went from cancering around 4-8 connections to >15 right after relaunch with the new release

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> this is a slight change that makes me very happy ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <paia> every staking wallet is a full node
